marytts.server
Class Mary

java.lang.Object
  marytts.server.Mary

public class Mary
extends java.lang.Object

The main program for the mary TtS system. It can run as a socket server or as a stand-alone program.

Author:
Marc Schröder

addJarsToClasspath

protected static void addJarsToClasspath()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Add jars to classpath. Normally this is called from startup().

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

startup

public static void startup()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Start the MARY system and all modules. This method must be called once before any calls to #process() are possible. The method will dynamically extend the classpath to all jar files in MARY_BASE/java/*.jar. Use startup(false) if you do not want to automatically extend the classpath in this way.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the system is not offline.
java.lang.Exception

startup

public static void startup(boolean addJarsToClasspath)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Start the MARY system and all modules. This method must be called once before any calls to #process() are possible.

Parameters:
addJarsToClasspath - if true, the method will dynamically extend the classpath to all jar files in MARY_BASE/java/*.jar; if false, the classpath will remain unchanged.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the system is not offline.
java.lang.Exception

shutdown

public static void shutdown()
Orderly shut down the MARY system.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the MARY system is not running.

process

public static void process(java.lang.String input,
                           java.lang.String inputTypeName,
                           java.lang.String outputTypeName,
                           java.lang.String localeString,
                           java.lang.String audioTypeName,
                           java.lang.String voiceName,
                           java.lang.String style,
                           java.lang.String effects,
                           java.lang.String outputTypeParams,
                           java.io.OutputStream output)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Process input into output using the MARY system. For inputType TEXT and output type AUDIO, this does text-to-speech conversion; for other settings, intermediate processing results can be generated or provided as input.

Parameters:
input -
inputTypeName -
outputTypeName -
localeString -
audioType -
voiceName -
style -
effects -
outputTypeParams -
output - the output stream into which the processing result will be written.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the MARY system is not running.
java.lang.Exception

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
The starting point of the standalone Mary program. If server mode is requested by property settings, starts the MaryServer; otherwise, a Request is created reading from the file given as first argument and writing to System.out.

Usage:

As a socket server: 

 java -Dmary.base=$MARY_BASE -Dserver=true marytts.server.Mary

As a stand-alone program: 

 java -Dmary.base=$MARY_BASE marytts.server.Mary myfile.txt

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
MaryProperties, MaryServer, RequestHandler, Request
